p: Based on the future climate scenarios of Representative Concentration Pathways (RCPs) [ 21], annual mean surface temperatures in the eastern United States are predicted with the greatest increase from 2006 to 2100 under RCP 8.5 scenario (+5.7°C), followed by RCP 6.0 (+4.1°C), RCP 4.5 (+3.2°C), and RCP 2.6 (+1.2°C) scenarios ( S1 Fig). These four RCP scenarios are new ones presented in the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Fifth Assessment Report (AR5) and provide time-dependent projections of atmospheric greenhouse gas concentrations [ 21]. The simulated increases in surface air temperature over the eastern United States during the 21 st century would be significant enough to impact growth and development of arthropods based on temperature increase in the United States during the last century (< +1°C).
